title: Riak Recap for August 15 - 16
description:
Posted on August 17, 2011

Afternoon, Evening, Morning to All -

Great Recap for today: new Python and Ruby Code, talks, blog posts, a great job opportunity, and more.

Enjoy.

Mark

Riak Recap for August 15 – 16

  1. Andy Gross is giving a talk on Riak at the NoCal Oracle Users Group tomorrow in San Ramon. (Yes, I said “Oracle”.)
    → Details here
  2. Parnell Springmeyer has a new repo up on BitBucket called “riakc”, a command-line interface for Riak built using Python. Thanks, Parnell!
    → Repo here
    → On PyPI
  3. We put some Riak Office Hours on the calendar for tomorrow in New York City. Sean Cribbs will be in town and hacking from the General Assembly offices from 2-5.
    →Details here
  4. One great Riak job to pass along to anyone in the UK – The Mobile Interactive Group is hiring an Application Developer skilled in Riak, Erlang, and Ruby. Interested parties can email david@migcan.com directly.
    → Full description here
  5. We added a Creative Commons License to the Riak Wiki.
    → Check the footer here
  6. Brian Lee Yung Rowe is quickly turning into one of the most prolific bloggers in the Riak Community. His latest post is called ‘Teaser: Running R as a map/reduce job from Riak.’ Go read it. Then subscribe to his blog. Thanks, Brian!
    → Post here
  7. Eric Redmond tweeted a Riak-inspired comic (and I’m assuming he’s the creator).
    → Print this out and put it on your wall
  8. Mathias Meyer released a new library called “riaktivity.” The code is still quite young but it’s goal is to make it easier to store timelines in Riak with Ruby. Thanks, Mathias!
    → Code here
